elements.title: drops of liquid (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Doc Edgerton created a stroboscope that he used to take high-speed photographs of bullets being shot, insects flying, and drops of liquid (pictured)?

elements.title: Michael Jerrell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Michael Jerrell was the only player from the NCAA Division II level to be selected in the 2024 NFL draft?

elements.title: Not in Love (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Crystal Castles canceled their studio recording plans for "Not in Love" because of Robert Smith's demo vocals?

elements.title: John Henry Hirst (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that architect John Henry Hirst designed at least nine Grade II listed buildings, including Cambridge Crescent, Harrogate, which hosts the newsroom of the Stray Ferret?

elements.title: Nosy Komba (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nosy Komba is a destination for both ecotourism and illegal logging?

elements.title: his birthday (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, the founder and first president of Bangladesh, experienced his birthday in jail eight times?

elements.title: Hadriana in All My Dreams (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Hadriana in All My Dreams, published in 1988, was the first novel by a Haitian author to win a major French literary award?

elements.title: Hendrik Wortman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Hendrik Wortman oversaw the early development of the Zuiderzee Works, which dammed off the Zuiderzee to create arable land in the Netherlands?

elements.title: Bardi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that though Donatello was a Bardi, he was not a Bardi?
